content: polar vortex cowl by kelly komejan crafts this cowl is crocheted with bulky yarn and an extra big hook to make a squishy drapey and warm cowl it fits close around the neck without being tight and is extra tall for pulling up to keep even your ears and face warm sure to keep your neck warm no matter what winter throws at you think this would be cute as an infinity cowl too just start with double or more stitches and work to desired height when wrapped it would show off both sides of this simple but lovely stitch since there is no pattern repeat it s super easy to adjust the size to customize it supplies 2 skeins cascade 128 model done in color #1910 size p or q crochet hook mine was 12mm somewhere in between finished size 20 circumference x 14 ½ tall directions fsc 40 sts this makes for a nice stretchy start join with a slip_stitch to work in the round being careful not to twist round 1 chain 2 counts as double_crochet double_crochet in each stitch around join with slip_stitch to top of chain 2 from beginning of round 40 sts round 2 chain 2 fpdc in each st around join to chain 2 at beginning of row with a slip_stitch by inserting hook through the space made by the chain 2 from back to front this replicates the fpdc you did on the rest of the stitches 40 sts repeat round 2 until you re almost out of yarn or until it is the desired height mine was 26 rounds final round chain 1 single_crochet in each st around not through front posts this time weave in ends and bundle up abbreviations chain chain double_crochet double_crochet fpdc front post double_crochet fsc foundation single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch st s stitch es 1 kellykomejancrafts@gmail com
